frameDefinitions: An implicit experiencer has an Experience for the first time.
An Agent resumes participation in an Activity.
An Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as characterized as having an emotion of fear concerning a particular Topic or as evoked by a Stimulus.
A Speaker addresses an Audience on a particular Topic.

An Item is picked out either by the order in which the members of a set would be encountered by an implicit cognizer, or by the order in which the members of a set participate in an event or state which serves as the Basis_of_order.

This frame deals with a Speaker communicating a reply or response, a Message, to some prior communication or action, the Trigger.  '' 'The landlord has not yet replied in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.
frameExamples: In Italy the term was <t>first</t> used by the Venetians in 1546
Normal Service Will Be <t>Resumed</t> Shortly. CNI
I was <t>scared</t> by a bump in the night.
McNamara <t>addressed</t> congress on the state of affairs of the Department of Defense.
The <t>first</t> car from the left is a Magosix.
The landlord has not yet <t>replied</t> in writing to the tenant objecting the proposed alterations.DNI
listRoleDefinitions: An event happens for the first time within the <fen>Context</fen>.
The <fen>Activity</fen> which is being resumed by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> who resumes an <fen>Activity</fen> that they were engaged in earlier.
When the Activity is resumed.
Where the event takes place.
The <fen>Experiencer</fen> is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the general area in which the emotion occurs.  It indicates a range of possible <fen>Stimulus</fen>.
The <fen>Stimulus</fen> is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.

The body part, gesture, or other expression of the <fen>Experiencer</fen> that reflects his or her emotional state.  They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun.
The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Experiencer</fen>, <fen>Expressor</fen>, or <fen>State</fen> can be described as having said emotion.
The person or persons to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> delivers their text.
The person who orally delivers a text about a <fen>Topic</fen> to a passive <fen>Audience</fen>.
What the text that the <fen>Speaker</fen> produces is about.
The <fen>Time</fen> describes when the speaking occurs.
The <fen>Place</fen> describes the location where the speaking occurs.
The kind of entity that the <fen>Item</fen> belongs to.
A usually spatial reference point from which the implicit cognizer scans across the members of the <fen>Comparison_set</fen>.
A kind of event in which the members of the <fen>Comparison_set</fen>, including the <fen>Item</fen>, participate in a certain order.
The entity picked out by the implicit cognizer as occupying a certain place in the ordered <fen>Comparison_set</fen>.
A set of entites of which the <fen>Item</fen> is a member and which are ordered either by the <fen>Basis_of_order</fen> or by the order in which the implicit cognizer focuses attention on them.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that communicates the reply or response. It is expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of a <t>Target</t> verb or as the Genitive modifier of a <t>Target</t> noun:
This is the person to whom the response is communicated.  When expressed, this role occurs as the direct object of a <t>Target</t> verb, or in a prepositional phrase introduced by 'to':
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause.
<fen>Topic</fen> occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun <t>Target</t>:
The <fen>Trigger</fen> is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  makes a verbal response.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Made from flax, linen was</fex> first <fex>used by the ancient Egyptians</fex>.
We have renewed <fex>our efforts to gain federal recognition</fex>.
<fex>We</fex> renewed our efforts to get things completed.
He lectured <fex>to the officers of the Scots Guard</fex>  in  1929.
<fex>You</fex> have to sermonize about the good times
He was the Director: he could lecture <fex>on whomever he liked</fex>.
Capitalizes the first letter of the first <fex>word</fex> in each sentence
Yes, I covered the cycle issue in  the second paragraph <fex>from the top</fex>.
Lorna was the third student <fex>to be expelled from the Academy</fex>.
Bennett is the fifth woman to be showcased.
The first student <fex>of the college</fex> to cross the ramp will present the name-card reader with a card having the name of the college printed on it. .
My boss still hasn't given me an answer <fex>about a promotion</fex>.
A reminder letter was sent to all nonrespondents who had not replied <fex>after 28 days</fex>.
This was how Tamil Nadu Chief Minister Jayalalithaa responded <fex>in the Assembly</fex> on November 5, 2003.
